title: ICE:  no MIR available for DefId

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: E-needs-mcve
labels.description: Call for participation: This issue needs a Minimal Complete and Verifiable Example

labels.name: requires-custom-config
labels.description: This issue requires custom config/build for rustc in some way

body:
### Code When running `x,py clippy` clippy calls rustc on `rustc_tools_util` while checking its own code, and rustc chokes somehow. I have been able to reproduce this with standalone `rustc_tools_util` for some reason. ```Rust src/tools/clippy/rustc_tools_util ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.62.0-nightly (cb1219871 2022-05-08) binary: rustc commit-hash: cb121987158d69bb894ba1bcc21dc45d1e0a488f commit-date: 2022-05-08 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.62.0-nightly LLVM version: 14.0.1 ``` ### Error output ``` ```
Backtrace

``` Finished release [optimized] target(s) in 0.02s < CodegenBackend { target: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu, backend: "gcc" } > Clippy { target: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu } c Assemble { target_compiler: Compiler { stage: 0, host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu } } c Rustc { target: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu } c Libdir { compiler: Compiler { stage: 0, host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu }, target: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu } c Sysroot { compiler: Compiler { stage: 0, host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu } } c Sysroot { compiler: Compiler { stage: 0, host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu } } c Llvm { target: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu } c Sysroot { compiler: Compiler { stage: 0, host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu } } Checking stage0 clippy artifacts (x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu -> x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu) "-Aclippy::wrong_self_convention" Fresh unicode-xid v0.2.2 Fresh version_check v0.9.3 Fresh matches v0.1.8 Fresh tinyvec v0.3.4 Fresh percent-encoding v2.1.0 Fresh itoa v0.4.6 Fresh arrayvec v0.7.0
